item.title: Under the Virtual Tree: Social VR as a Gateway Experience
item.description:
Under the Virtual Tree: Social VR as a Gateway Experience

Social VR is going to be big, and mobile VR platforms are poised to lead the way. Could this be the "gateway drug" to mass-market VR adoption?

item.title: VR is better when virtual objects feel real
item.description:
VR is better when virtual objects feel real

In Raw Data, two players use an assortment of weapons to protect a shared VR play space from an oncoming horde of killer robots. At first blush, this feels a lot like any other motion-controlled first-person VR action game: aiming with virtual guns, fanatically shooting in all directions and generally feeling like an action hero while doing it -- but when I swung the game's laser sword at another blade, something weird happened.

item.title: Vision Summit 2016 Keynote
item.description:
Vision Summit 2016 Keynote

Vision VR/AR Summit is an all-new cross industry event for artists, engineers, programmers, designers, musicians, directors and producers, hardware manufacturers and researchers. http://visionsummit2016.com/

item.title: Amazon Launches Lumberyard Beta Game Engine for Free - VR Guru
item.description:
Amazon Launches Lumberyard Beta Game Engine for Free - VR Guru

Online retail giant Amazon is well known for trialling new technologies, looking a ways it can leverage its massive selling power. Back in december amazon received patent approval for an augmented reality (AR) mapping system, and now its moving into videogame design as well.

item.title: Virtual Reality Video Game Industry to Generate $5.1 Billion in 2016
item.description:
Virtual Reality Video Game Industry to Generate $5.1 Billion in 2016

Video games will be the key driver of virtual reality hardware this year, according to a new report from SuperData Research. Game developers will also have a global audience of 55.8 million virtual reality users and produce 38.9 million virtual reality devices this year, according to the report.

item.title: Palmer Luckey on Touch Room-Scale Tracking: "The issue is already put to bed"
item.description:
Palmer Luckey on Touch Room-Scale Tracking: "The issue is already put to bed"

The Oculus VR founder made an unexpected appearance on Reddit to issue the final word on a burning question: Can the Rift's Touch controllers work at room-scale?

item.title: The Oculus Rift, Presence, Hype, and the Fundamentals of VR
item.description:
The Oculus Rift, Presence, Hype, and the Fundamentals of VR

When the HTC Vive introduced the concepts of room-scale and Chaperone to the emerging VR marketplace, it introduced some welcome innovation to an enthusiastic public. It also shifted the conversation away from what really matters.

item.title: Magic Leap Raises $794 Million And Announces "Mixed Reality Lightfield" - UploadVR
item.description:
Magic Leap Raises $794 Million And Announces "Mixed Reality Lightfield" - UploadVR

Magic Leap raised $794 million in new funding and CEO Rony Abovitz posted a blog suggesting the secretive company is moving closer toward a product, writing "we are setting up supply chain operations, manufacturing." Techcrunch reports Alibaba founder Jack Ma is joining Magic Leap's board.

item.title: 'The Hobbit' VR Experience Nominated for Visual Effects Award
item.description:
'The Hobbit' VR Experience Nominated for Visual Effects Award

Thief in the Shadows, a VR experience based on The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug (2013), has been nominated for a Visual Effects Society award for 'Outstanding Visual Effects in a Real-Time Project'.

item.title: NASA Is Using Unreal Engine 4 To Make Mars A Virtual Reality
item.description:
NASA Is Using Unreal Engine 4 To Make Mars A Virtual Reality

NASA has teamed up with Fusion Media, MIT, and game developers to make The Mars 2030 Experience.
